channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

Report X-2023070136

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. UPON INSPECTION, TWO BOTTLES HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. DescribePack: TWO BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report X-2023070024
item.description:
Report X-2023070024

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found at the ORDR facility with signs of a release. While investigating the package it was discovered that the fiberboard box contained a single metal can of Galvanizing Compound. The SDS has this listed as a UN1263 packing group III. The fiberboard box didn't have any hazardous material marking or the required paperwork. The fiberboard box was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023061704
item.description:
Report X-2023061704

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The processed hazmat was located in the haz cage inside of a tote with liquid in the bottom. Further inspection of the corrosive marked package confirmed that one of the bottles of condenser coil cleaner was half empty. It appears the cap caused release of product. Pressure inside carton may have caused release. DescribePack: Top on cap loose. No visible holes or cracks DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in tote and placed under hood

item.title: Report E-2023070157
item.description:
Report E-2023070157

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 20, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2735 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The damaged drum and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal. The drum was properly labeled, and possession of the material was taken by RLC to be disposed of through their bulk waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023070147
item.description:
Report E-2023070147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 15, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surface. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the ink-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. HCE personnel patched the damaged drum and placed it into one (1) 85 gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one poly 55 gallon drum of sygenta force (un3352) had a damaged/crushed lid from transit and that there was a release of one cup of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070124
item.description:
Report E-2023070124

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-07
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 5 gallon pails of flexituff (un1139) releasing 5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023061616
item.description:
Report X-2023061616

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded from trailer 828232 it was discovered wet and leaking. There is visible damage to the outer box causing the inner bottle to be punctured and leak out. DescribePack: One of the bottles has a small puncture mark on the side and was gradually leaking a total of 6 ounces. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a lined tote and taken to the Haz Mat cage to be processed.
